title: What To Know For This Fall And Winter Virus Season
content:
for
everyone ages 6 months and older
. Vaccination is especially important for people who are at increased risk of severe disease, such as adults 65 years and older, people with certain health conditions, nursing homes residents, and pregnant women.
CDC now recommends
that people that are immunocompromised or 65 years and older receive another dose of the 2024-2025 COVID-19 vaccine 6 months after receiving their first dose.
RSV vaccines for older adults
